intro: Halimolobos pubens, commonly known as the hairy halimolobos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
